Job Posting:174582 - Position: W26 Co-op Student - Analyst Trainee 174582 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 10/27/2025 09:00 AM Through UBC Science Co-op 10/20/2025 02:59 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Collings Johnston Inc 400-409 Granville Street Vancouver V6C 1T2 British Columbia Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration 2026 - Winter W26 Co-op Student - Analyst Trainee 174582 Co-op Position Vancouver, BC Canada 8 or 12 months Salary Currency CAD Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 23.0 per hour for 0 Major List $23-24 Job title: Co-op Student - Analyst Trainee Reports to: CJI Principal - Director of Operations Study Requirements: 3rd or 4th year Engineering Student Job Starting Date: Starting January 2026 Job Time-frame: 8 month - 12 co-op term Compensation: Hourly rate wage based on a 40 hr work week Job Location: In person - Collings Johnston Inc. (CJI) Office #1550-409 Granville Street, Vancouver CJI Contact: Shahesha Lock - CJI Corporate Affairs slock@collingsjohnston.com Our Company We are a leading Vancouver-based technical management consulting company committed to advancing major Canadian infrastructure projects across BC and Canada. Based downtown Vancouver, our team of 20 professionals works with project owners, engineers, contractors, and stakeholders to navigate complex initiatives through project management and strategic advisory services. You'll find our team contributing to key infrastructure projects initiatives for TransLink, Port of Vancouver, BC Ferries, Ministry of Transit and Transportation Infrastructure, major utilities, and municipalities. We guide transportation and infrastructure projects from planning through implementation, tailoring our approach to each client's specific challenges. Come Work With Us! You'll work in a collaborative environment where mentorship and knowledge sharing are part of daily practice. We value a work culture that fosters team work, mentorship, knowledge sharing, service excellence, ethical integrity, and professional growth-along with maintaining balance between work and life outside the office. What you'll learn: Working alongside senior engineers and project management specialists, and depending on our current assignment portfolio, you will gain-hands-on experience in areas such as: Project Management & Technical Skills • Cost estimation, forecasting, and risk management • Project management software (Microsoft Project, Planner) • Schedule development, critical path analysis, and risk assessment techniques • Project schedule analysis techniques, such as the critical path method. • Project lifecycle management and stage-gate process • Understand client relationship management. Development of key project documents including charters, plans, and progress reports. • Business Operations • Process improvement initiatives Business information systems and decision-support tools • Industry Exposure • Real challenges and opportunities in infrastructure delivery • Industry standards and best practices The language and concepts of major infrastructure project delivery • Professional Development • Networking with industry professionals through meetings and events • Fluency in collaboration across communication tools and platforms Professional communication in a consulting environment • Job Requirements What we are looking for: • Curiosity and initiative, with strong attention to detail • Solid communication and teamwork skills • Strong writing, editing, and proofreading abilities • Critical thinking and problem-solving aptitude • Organizational skills and the ability to juggle competing priories • Proficiency with Microsoft 365 • Capability to develop professional documents, graphics, and reports • Professionalism and discretion with confidential information Prior experience with engineering or project management firms is helpful but not required • N/A Citizenship Requirement APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through UBC Science Co-op Cover Letter Required? Yes Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager
